The 'Ebro' () or 'Ebre' () is one of the most important rivers in the Iberian
Peninsula. It is the biggest river by discharge volume in Spain.

The Ebro flows through the following cities: *Reinosa in Cantabria *Frias
(Burgos), Castile and LeÃ³n *Miranda de Ebro in Castile and LeÃ³n *Haro, LogroÃ±o,
Calahorra, and Alfaro in La Rioja *Tudela in Navarre *AlagÃ³n, Utebo, Zaragoza,
and Caspe in Aragon *Flix, MÃ³ra d'Ebre, Benifallet, Tivenys, Xerta, Aldover,
Tortosa, and Amposta in Catalonia
